title: Kadari Church
about: The Kadari Church is located in the village of Dzveli Abasha, Abasha Municipality, Samegrelo region. It was built no earlier than the XIV century. The temple came down to us in a very damaged form, the northern and western walls and vault are collapsed. The church is a hall building with a semicircular apse facing east. The building, on the south and west sides, had annexes, which are currently destroyed. The hall was covered with a lancet vault. There are three narrow windows cut in the apse. There are two entrances, on the south and west side. Small fragments of paintings have been preserved in the interior. The church is built of bricks.
